Lack enough support: The claim lacks evidence or citations to support the assertion that the security guard was an accomplice.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the security guard was involved in the shooting without providing sufficient evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the findings of the law enforcement agency leading the investigation, which confirmed that Stephen Paddock was the only shooter.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the security guard by suggesting he was involved in the initial shooting as a second gunman.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of faltering bias in the provided claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations and presents the security guard as the sole accomplice.
